abstracts.cdata!:
The Urban Natural Hazard Vulnerability
            Reduction Project will re-house affected people in the
            November 2001 floods and people currently living under
            hazardous buildings, vulnerable to mud-flows, floods and
            earthquakes. The Government has prepared a Resettlement
            Policy Framework (RPF) to define all rules and procedures
            related to the re-housing of affected people. The RPF
            defines relevant policies, Algerian laws in effect and
            implementation arrangements, and presents the outlines of
            Resettlement Action Plan (RAP) that will be needed during
            project implementation. The preparation of the RAP will
            follow these steps defined by the RPF: 1) identification and
            minimization of the impacts; 2) social assessment and public
            consultation; 3) definition of the re-housing sites; and 4)
            preparation and implementation of RAP. Eligibility criteria,
            procedures, and modalities of the allocation of social
            rental housing are defined in the Executive Decree 92-48.
            Local authorities will conduct public consultations to
            enable affected people to communicate their needs and expectations.
